{{main|Rohirrim}} '''Eorlingas''' or '''Eorlings'''{{App|Men}}, p. 1129 was a name the [[Rohirrim]] sometimes used for themselves, as followers and descendants of their first [[Kings of Rohan|King]], [[Eorl]]{{App|Eorl}}, entry for King Eorl the Young, p. 1064{{RK|Muster}}, pp. 797 and 803. The word was used in a call to arms chanted by King [[Théoden]] when [[Gandalf]] had healed him:{{TT|King}}, p. 517 {{quote|Arise now, arise, Riders of Théoden!
Dire deeds awake, dark it is eastward.
Let horse be bridled, horn be sounded!
Forth Eorlingas!|King Théoden}}It was also used by the armed men standing nearby after the healing, by [[Háma]] when he suggested [[Éowyn]] as the regent of [[Rohan]] during the absence of King Théoden{{TT|King}}, p. 523, by Théoden and his riders,{{TT|King}}, p. 524 and by Théoden to rally the Rohirrim during the [[Battle of the Hornburg]]{{TT|Deep}}, p. 540and the [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]]{{RK|Battle}}, p. 840. ==Etymology== ''Eorlingas'' is an [[Old English]] name, which means "People of Eorl". It contains the elements ''[[Eorl#Etymology|eorl]]'' and ''[[-ings|-ingas]]'' ("people").{{HM|RC}}, p. 407 The word is an Old English translation of the [[Rohanese]] '''''þorunahim''''' (sg. '''''þuron''''').{{PE|22}}, p. 159 {{references}} [[Category:Old English names]] [[Category:Rohirrim]]
